title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview and it felt very pre-staged and as if they were going through the motions. Went ok and was then called back for a zoom interview. During the first round I sensed they were rushing through. The second interview went well, but I sensed a hiring decision had already been determined. There were other red flags this was the case. I later learned someone internally got the job.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey
Interview Descriptions: It was a teaching demonstration in a class of 20 students and 3 professors. Questions afterwards. The class is friendly. No real tough questions. But need to show good teaching manners and ability to interact with students.
Interview Questions: What’s your five year plan.

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (Mahwah, NJ) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: for this job there was not an interview process that people who wanted this job had to go through. you simply had to apply for the job. there were no questions asked
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Special Assistant to the Vice Provost Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (Mahwah, NJ) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I first had a skype interview with the search committee which was a very open discussion about my experience and what they envisioned for the position. I was then invited for an in-person interview with the committee. They were incredibly welcoming and warm. They were easy to talk to and made me feel comfortable which is rare in an interview. Following the committee interview, I completed a 15-minute assessment, followed by an one-on-one interview with the Vice Provost. He too was very welcoming and very enthusiastic about his work. I thoroughly enjoyed my interview experience and I hope my paths with cross with that team again in the future.
Interview Questions: How would you prioritize time-sensitive tasks?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Standard education process. Took about a month after meeting with 3 different people.  Was what I expected an interview in education to be.  Wasn’t too difficult was pretty average. Very nice campus!
Interview Questions: Explain my experience working with faculty and students

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with two people on the line who made is really clear by their strange line of questioning that they were not HR people,just people from their own dept.  This wasnt a “tell us about you and your experience” kind of chat and they didnt describe the actual role in much detail at all. They also were testing me to see if I read the job description in full.  Finally they showed no emotion to my responses so i was unable to figure out how the interview went. Zero follow up which i find wildly rude.
Interview Questions: What worries you the most about the position?

title: Professor of Art Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (Ramapo, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview seemed like an absolute formality as it was clear that they wanted to hire somebody else. I was trying to remain professional but there was just plain indifference and lack of curiosity
Interview Questions: Talk to us about your strength and weaknesses as a person

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a panel which consisted of members from various departments and students. It was straight to the point, sort of intimidating. Not you average interview of "tell me about yourself" etc.
Interview Questions: Tell me what can you bring to our campus? And what is important to you.

title: Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was easy, it takes me 2 weeks for application and shortly after that they call me for an interview. first was on skype, second in their office. usual questions like on every interview.
Interview Questions: are you team player? why are u thinking that u are team player?

title: Director Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (Bronx, NY) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Face-to-face meeting with Hiring Manager.  Submission of writing sample.  Review of employment with a former affiliate of the company.  Discussion of where I saw myself in 5 years.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in 5 years

title: Alumni Relations Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (Mahwah, NJ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process between my manager (Vice President of the College) and I was thorough.  Manager asks everything necessary to ensure that I was a good fit as an Alumni Relations Aide.
Interview Questions: What will you do to increase the quality of the Alumni experience through our on-campus events,  our monthly eNewsletters, and our social media content?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey
Interview Descriptions: At Ramapo College I walked into the conference room where the interview was held. I was told to sit at the end of a very long conference table. Odd thing was, the five people on the search committee sat at the other end of the table. Each person asked one generic question. Then they asked me if I had any questions. I asked one, and then they said thanks for coming, so i stood up and left. It was unprofessional, especially since they were working in a career center.
Interview Questions: "Why do you want to leave your current job? Is there something wrong?"

title: Office Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (Mahwah, NJ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy.  I was brought in and interviewed with 3 people at once.  They just kept firing questions and I kept answering.  Just be prepared like all other interviews and you will do well
Interview Questions: What is my biggest flaw

title: Student Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey
Interview Descriptions: I was initially contact by the search committee.  Invited on campus for an interview with the search committee (about 5-6 people).  After getting moved forward to the next round, was invited back on campus for an interview with  the Associate Director and Director of the office before being offered the position.
Interview Questions: Questions were right to the point, and were given examples of student transcripts and asked to analyze them during the interview.

title: Temp Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ramapo College of New Jersey (East Brunswick, NJ) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Simple computer skills testing. 

1:1 Interview with Temp Placement Officer was easy and painless. 

Questions such as:

What is your ultimate career goal?
Why are you choosing to temp?
What are your preferred work hours?
How far are you willing to commute? 

Recruiter I spoke with was friendly and personable. Offered me several possible positions on the spot and said she would call employers within the day to see if they were interested in hiring me. Was placed within the week and am incredibly pleased with the results.
Interview Questions: What is your ultimate career goal?
